Question: On the first anniversary of the ____s' marriage, the poet Ellery Channing came to the Old Manse for help.
Hints: At the Old Manse, this person wrote most of the tales collected in Mosses from an Old Manse.
This person admitted he had aged considerably, referring to himself as "wrinkled with time and trouble".
This person was appointed the corresponding secretary of the Salem Lyceum in 1848.
